    • Constructor Detail

      • SortedTable.Searcher

        protected SortedTable.Searcher(ByteBuffer buffer,
                    int rowWidth,
                    RowOrder order)
        Creates a new instance with the given backing buffer. The buffer must be at least MIN_BUFFER_ROWS rows wide. Also, if the buffer's capacity is not a multiple of the the table's row width, it logs nagging warnings.

      • getHitRowNumber

        public long getHitRowNumber()
        Returns the row index of the hit. If not found, it returns the insertion point as a negative value: -insertionPoint - 1 .

      • getHitRow

        public ByteBuffer getHitRow()
        Returns the hit row, if any. 
        
        public ByteBuffer getHitRow() {
          return isHit() ? getRow(hitRowNumber) : null;
        }

      • isRowInBuffer

        public boolean isRowInBuffer(long rowNumber)
        Determines whether the given row is already loaded. 
        
   return rowNumber < getLastRetrievedRowNumber() && rowNumber >= getFirstRetrievedRowNumber();
        See Also:
        getRow(long)

      • getRow

        public ByteBuffer getRow(long rowNumber)
                  throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns a read-only view of an already retrieved row, given its row number.
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - row number in the range getFirstRetrievedRowNumber() (inclusive), getLastRetrievedRowNumber() (exclusive)
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if rowNumber is outside the retrieved range
        See Also:
        isRowInBuffer(long), copyRowInto(long, ByteBuffer)

      • copyRowInto

        public void copyRowInto(long rowNumber,
               ByteBuffer buffer)
                 throws IndexOutOfBoundsException,
                        BufferOverflowException
        Copies the contents of the given already retrieved rowNumber to the specified buffer. The position of the given buffer is advanced by the underlying table's row width.

        This is functionally equivalent to 

        
 Searcher seacher = ..
 buffer.put(searcher.getRow(rowNumber));
        except that it's marginally more efficient.

        Parameters:
        rowNumber - row number in the range getFirstRetrievedRowNumber() (inclusive), getLastRetrievedRowNumber() (exclusive)
        buffer - the buffer to which the row's contents will be put
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if rowNumber is outside the retrieved range
        BufferOverflowException - if buffer's remaining bytes is less than the underlying table's row width
        See Also:
        isRowInBuffer(long), getRow(long)

      • compareToRetrievedRow

        public int compareToRetrievedRow(ByteBuffer key,
                        long rowNumber)
        Returns the result of comparing the given key with contents of the specified rowNumber.

      • getRows

        public ByteBuffer getRows(long rowNumber,
                 int count)
                   throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Returns the shared, read-only view of the specified rows already loaded in the search buffer. Since it's shared, the returned buffer is for immediate consumption: it must be used before the next invocation of this method or of search(ByteBuffer).
        Parameters:
        rowNumber - row number in the range getFirstRetrievedRowNumber() (inclusive), getLastRetrievedRowNumber() (exclusive)
        count - the number of rows to return in the buffer
        Returns:
        the shared read-only view of the search buffer, its remaining bytes the contents of the specified rows
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException

        public SortedTable getTable()
